oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Root Numbers of Asai L-Functions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ANANDAVARDHANAN, UK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: artin l-function
unitary groups
distinguished representations
epsilon factors
local-field
conjecture
nonnegativity
reducibility
equation
poles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Let E/F be a quadratic extension of p-adic fields. We compute the value of is an element of(1/2, pi, r,psi) for a square integrable representation pi of GL(n)(E), which is (Galois) conjugate self-dual, where r denotes the Asai representation. This is the twisted version of a well-known result due to Bushnell and Henniart. The proof makes use of a result on the corresponding global root number, which is proved by a method conceived by Lapid and Rallis.
